foils.name: Arya's Foil
foils.flavor: Insert into yourself or any other target to heal all statuses.

foils.name: Card Pack
foils.description: RNG chance to get a random foil
foils.flavor: Pack of 5 random cards. Roll RNG 4+ to pull a Foil, and roll for type.

foils.name: Drury's Foil
foils.flavor: Insert into a freshly tilted ally to revive them before they respawn elsewhere.

foils.name: Dungeon Foil
foils.description: Removes you & 1 ally from a dungeon or encounter
foils.flavor: Insert into the ground to remove yourself and one ally from a dungeon or encounter, taking you back to the nearest settlement.

foils.name: Hafgan's Foil
foils.description: Heals all statuses for you & allies
foils.flavor: Insert into yourself to heal all statuses afflicting you and your allies.

foils.name: Healing Foil
foils.flavor: Insert into yourself or any other target to automatically heal d6 Sync.

foils.name: Lucky Foil
foils.flavor: Insert into yourself to reroll one RNG roll.

foils.name: Shadow Foil
foils.flavor: Insert into your weapon to imbue it with shadow damage. Insert it into your armor to negate the next shadow damage you take.

foils.name: Solar Foil
foils.flavor: Insert into your weapon to imbue it with solar damage. Insert it into your armor to negate the next solar damage you take.

description: There's a sect of players obsessed with .dungeon's pseudo-collectible card game. Card packs have a small chance of containing Foils, holographic cards that act as one-use magic items in place of potions and other consumables. The game's true card-heads believe there's a connection between Aspect cards and the collectible card game.
